com.camerontec.catalys.server.security.auth

Class XmlLoginModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.server.security.auth.XmlLoginModule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LoginModule

    public class XmlLoginModule
extends Object
implements LoginModule
    This LoginModule authenticates users with a password taken from an XML file specifying users and their groups.

    If a user is authenticated a SimpleUserPrincipal with the user's name is added to the Subject. A SimpleGroupPrincipal is also added for each group the user belongs to (as specified in the XML).

    This LoginModule recognizes the debug option. If set to true in the login Configuration, debug messages will be logged.

    The login configuration should also contain the path name of the file containing the XML user data. This is specified by the "userFile" option.

    A sample login configuration might look like: 

     Catalys {
            com.camerontec.catalys.server.security.auth.XmlLoginModule required
            debug="true"
            userFile="monitorUsers.xml";
          };
    A sample XML file might look like (note the standard DTD definition contained in the file): 
     <!DOCTYPE Users [
          <!ELEMENT Users (User*)>
 
            <!ELEMENT User (Group*)>
            <!ATTLIST User name     CDATA #REQUIRED
                           password CDATA #REQUIRED>
 
              <!ELEMENT Group EMPTY>
              <!ATTLIST Group name  CDATA #REQUIRED>
        ]>
 
        <Users>
          <User name="john" password="crocodile">
            <Group name="trader"/>
            <Group name="operations"/>
          </User>
        </Users>
    The DTD definition cannot change without changing this class's code.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize(Subject subject,
                       CallbackHandler callbackHandler,
                       Map<String,?> sharedState,
                       Map<String,?> options)
        Initialize this LoginModule.

        Specified by:
        initialize in interface LoginModule
        Parameters:
        subject - the Subject to be authenticated.
        callbackHandler - a CallbackHandler for communicating with the end user (prompting for user names and passwords, for example).
        sharedState - shared LoginModule state.
        options - options specified in the login Configuration for this particular LoginModule.

      • login

        public boolean login()
              throws LoginException
        Authenticate the user using the user name and password returned by the call backs.
        Specified by:
        login in interface LoginModule
        Returns:
        true in all cases since this LoginModule should not be ignored.
        Throws:
        FailedLoginException - if the authentication fails.
        LoginException - if this LoginModule is unable to perform the authentication.

      • commit

        public boolean commit()
               throws LoginException
        This method is called if the LoginContext's overall authentication succeeded (the relevant REQUIRED, REQUISITE, SUFFICIENT and OPTIONAL LoginModules succeeded).

        If this LoginModule's own authentication attempt succeeded (checked by retrieving the private state saved by the login method), then this method associates a SimpleUserPrincipal and any SimpleGroupPrincipals with the Subject located in the LoginModule.

        Specified by:
        commit in interface LoginModule
        Returns:
        true if this LoginModule's own login and commit attempts succeeded, or false otherwise.
        Throws:
        LoginException - if the commit fails.

      • abort

        public boolean abort()
              throws LoginException
        This method is called if the LoginContext's overall authentication failed. (the relevant REQUIRED, REQUISITE, SUFFICIENT and OPTIONAL LoginModules did not succeed).

        If this LoginModule's own authentication attempt succeeded (checked by retrieving the private state saved by the login and commit methods), then this method cleans up any state that was originally saved.

        Specified by:
        abort in interface LoginModule
        Returns:
        false if this LoginModule's own login and/or commit attempts failed, and true otherwise.
        Throws:
        LoginException - if the abort fails.

      • logout

        public boolean logout()
               throws LoginException
        Logout the user.

        This method removes the Principals that were added by the commit() method.

        Specified by:
        logout in interface LoginModule
        Returns:
        true in all cases since this LoginModule should not be ignored.
        Throws:
        LoginException - if the logout fails.
